entry.title: TYEE RIDGE COMPLEX 46 PERCENT CONTAINED
entry.summary: September 9, 2023 10:30 a.m. The Tyee Ridge Complex is 46 percent contained and listed at 7,847 acres as of Saturday morning. The Oregon Department of Forestry Incident Management Team 3 assumed command of the complex Friday evening. 1,455 people are assigned to the fires. The effective securing of control lines and structure protection of...

entry.title: GOVERNOR ORDERS FLAGS LOWERED TO HALF-STAFF
entry.summary: September 9, 2023 10:00 a.m. On Saturday, Governor Tina Kotek ordered all flags at Oregon public institutions to be flown at half-staff until sunset Monday night in remembrance of the nearly 3,000 civilians and first responders that were killed in the 2001 terrorist attacks. Kotek said, “Today and every day, we must remember and honor...

entry.title: ROSEBURG WOMAN JAILED AFTER ALLEGED TRESPASS INCIDENT
entry.summary: September 9,2023 9:35 a.m. A Roseburg woman was jailed by Roseburg Police after an alleged trespass incident on Thursday. An RPD report said just after 5:30 p.m. officers responded to the 1600 block of West Harvard Avenue where a caller said the suspect was refusing to leave the property. Officers learned that the woman had...

entry.title: JUVENILE DETAINED FOR UNLAWFUL POSSESSION OF MARIJUANA
entry.summary: September 9, 2023 9:25 a.m. Roseburg Police detained a juvenile for unlawful possession of marijuana by a person under the age of 21 on Thursday. An RPD report said just after 1:00 p.m. officers responded to Jo Lane Middle School in the 2100 block of Northeast Vine Street after a caller said a 13-year old...

entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAIL MAN FOLLOWING ALLEGED DISORDERLY CONDUCT
entry.summary: September 9, 2023 9:20 a.m. Roseburg Police jailed a man following alleged disorderly conduct on Thursday. An RPD report said at 2:50 p.m. officers received multiple calls about the 37-year old walking into traffic in the 300 block of Southeast Pine Street. Officers warned the suspect of disorderly conduct. A few minutes later, officers received...

entry.title: GRANTS PASS MAN JAILED AFTER REPORTED ELUDE INCIDENT
entry.summary: September 9, 2023 8:50 a.m. A Grants Pass man was jailed after a reported elude incident on Friday night. Information from the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office said just after 9:30 p.m. a deputy attempted to stop a motorcycle rider on Interstate Five northbound three miles north of Glendale. The vehicle failed to yield and a...

entry.title: COTTAGE GROVE MAN JAILED AFTER ALLEGED ASSAULT
entry.summary: September 9, 2023 8:30 a.m. A Cottage Grove man was jailed after an alleged assault late Friday afternoon. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said shortly after 5:00 p.m. dispatchers received a 911 text from a victim stating that a man was beating her and she needed help. Deputies responded to the 400 block of...

entry.title: DFPA DEALS WITH MILEPOST 119 FIRE SOUTHBOUND FIRE
entry.summary: September 9, 2023 6:45 a.m. Friday afternoon at approximately 2:00 p.m., crews with the Douglas Forest Protective Association, along with Douglas County Fire District No.2 and the Winston-Dillard Fire District, responded to a 1/100th of an acre fire located in the center median of Interstate Five at the Winston exit near milepost 119. DFPA Public...

entry.title: WASHINGTON COUNTY MAN CHARGED IN OAKLAND AREA HOMICIDE
entry.summary: September 8, 2023 6:20 a.m. A Washington County man has been charged in connection with the murder of an Oakland area woman last month. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said through the course of the investigation, detectives identified 45-year old Dwayne Michael Lauka as a suspect in the death of 78-year old Terry Lea...

entry.title: DOWNGRADES TO TYEE RIDGE COMPLEX EVACUATION NOTICES
entry.summary: September 8, 2023 1:30 p.m. In coordination with fire managers, Douglas County Board of Commissioners and Douglas County Emergency Management, the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office has made a number of downgrades to evacuation notices for residents impacted by the Tyee Ridge Complex. These changes went into effect at 12:00 p.m. Friday. *Level 3 “GO” –...
